page.title: 20Wivenhoe - 1940s
page.content:
My family moved to Wivenhoe in the mid 1940s. We were told that we would need to live in Wivenhoe for ten years, and own a boat, before we could expect to be accepted. However, times were changing; my father's personality and politics (the post war landslide to Labour) gave him the opportunity to be Chairman of the Council.
Contribution by: Madeleine Prager
